CatDescriptText: Alma Ventura, 89 Wabash Street and Ella Taylor, 16 Bloomer Way, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think race relations are improved, are worse, or about the same today as compared to pre-World War II years?" Ms. Ventura's answer reads: "They are much improved from an overall viewpoint." Ms. Taylor's answer reads: "Much improved.  Looking on the job situation, I say that conditions are much better."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Alma Ventura wearing wool coat with rounded lapels, and light colored gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ella Taylor wearing belted tweed coat, and light colored head scarf, standing in front of May Building with Thrift Drugs, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
